newsitem.title: USA: Energen seeks FY 97 EPS growth above 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Energen seeks FY 97 EPS growth above 10 pct.

text.p: Energen Corp said on Wednesday its goal was to post earnings per share growth above 10 percent in its fiscal year ending September 30, 1997.

"We believe 1997 will be Energen's best year yet as we pursue earnings per share growth in excess of 10 percent a year," Energen President Mike Warren, said in a statement with the company's earnings.
The company posted fiscal 1996 earnings of $1.95 a share, a 10 percent gain over fiscal 1995's $1.77.
The company said it expected oil and gas production at its Tauris Exploration unit to increase 70 percent to more than 27 billion cubic feet equivalent in fiscal 1997.
Coalbed methane production is expected to generate more than $6 million in tax credits, it said.
Its Alabama Gas Corp (Alagasco) utility unit is in an "excellent position" to continue earning within its allowed range of return on average equity of 13.15 percent to 13.65 percent, it said.
